intro: Agrimonioides stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaf agrimonioides, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and strawberries, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its botanical features include a branched stem, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and fruits that develop into small, dry capsules. Agrimonioides stenantha is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, arid climates.
